title: Ticket #6034: Work around my_popenv error sensitivity.
description:
When condor_submit_dag calls condor_submit, it logs the error stream. One of users noticed a new warning in this log, which came from the following new line in the new default base Condor config: 

include ifexist command into $(LOCAL_CONFIG_DIR)/49ec2-instance.config : \
        /etc/condor/config.d/49ec2-instance.sh

The include-command syntax invokes my_popenv(), which will print the warning; the ifexist does not suppress warning messages (as you might expect). Although we suspect checking for existing won't have any false negatives (that a command which doesn't exist can still be executed), rather than worry about that and redo the my_popenv() plumbing, we decided it would better if we could move this line out of the base condor config and into a config file supplied by the EC2 package.

The reason for not doing that in the first place was that 49ec2-instance.config may download new configuration files, which would be ignored if they appear after processing of the config directory began. TJ pointed out an escape hatch: the config directories, plural, are processed one at a time, so that a script run from, say, /etc/condor/config.d/49ec2-instance.config could populate /etc/condor/config.d/dynamic and the config system would pay attention. However, we can't change the config directories list from a config directory file.

Therefore, the plan is to remove the problematic line from the default base config file, but change the default config directories to include config.d/dynamic (the config directories aren't searched recursively). To avoid warnings, we'll also alter the packages (or condor_install, for the tarballs) to ensure that directory exists at install time. Finally, the EC2 RPM (no deb yet, IIRC) will be adjusted to include the problematic line in config.d/49ec2-instance.config.

See #5787.
remarks:
2016-Dec-01 14:37:14 by tlmiller:
TJ points out that the hard-coded path to the script in the problematic config line should /also/ be $(LOCAL_CONFIG_DIR).

However, since that will be a list in this solution, some additional cleverness may be required.

2016-Dec-01 14:38:52 by tlmiller:
The first thing that comes to mind is to add a new variable in the root config when we add the dynamic directory to LOCAL_CONFIG_DIR, say, DYNAMIC_CONFIG_DIR, which we know will be singular.

2016-Dec-01 16:26:24 by tlmiller:
New plan, after discussion:

Immediately -- for 8.5.8 -- remove the line in question from the default root config and stop distributing the EC2 RPM.

Later -- consider rewriting the EC2 RPM as something which installs an extra initscript (which configures HTCondor with the instance-specific data (unconditionally/ignoring cache) and (re-; see previous parenthetical remark) downloads the new configuration.

2016-Dec-02 14:15:12 by tlmiller:
Reverting the previous two commit seemed safer than partial removal, and reversions don't require code review.

2016-Dec-02 14:17:48 by tlmiller:
We also don't appear to have documented the EC2 package anywhere yet, so I guess this doesn't need documentation changes.
